result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal C. Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 128 days presentenc credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

with work release and transfer privileges

15CF414 and 16CF32.  Defendant Crystal C. Matthews in court, in custody with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Vollan files plea forms/reviews stipulation.  DEF will be pleading to CT 1 in 16CF32 with CT 2 to be dismissed/read in,; also 15CF414 will be dismissed/read in.  PQWOR filed/reviewed with DEF.  Court reviews charges/penalties with DEF.  DEF enters no contest plea.  Court questions DEF.  Court finds factual basis.  Court finds plea was made FVKI and accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.  State heard/reviews history.  Parties agree with total of 128 days jail credit.  Atty Vollan heard.  DEF makes statement.  Court heard/orders:  DEF to be released from DCJ
